data.name: EnrollKeepAppInstalled
data.value: Keep Okta Verify installed on this device. You’ll need it to verify your identity to access your organization’s apps.

data.name: ErrorMessageGeneric
data.value: Something went wrong. Please try again.

data.name: ErrorMessageUrl
data.value: We couldn't find your sign-in URL.

data.name: KeyCreationUsageContext
data.value: Okta Verify wants to create a biometric key for your {0} account.
data.comment: Message shown by Windows Hello prompt on enrollment, placeholder is for a domain/company name

data.name: KeyLoadUsageContext
data.value: Please confirm your login to {0} through Okta Verify.
data.comment: Message shown by Windows Hello prompt on authentication, placeholder is for a domain/company name

data.name: KeyUsageDescription
data.value: Allows Okta Verify login to {0} with user consent.
data.comment: Description for the user verification key. The placeholder is for a domain/company name

data.name: RemoveAccountConfirmationText
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove this account?

data.name: OriginMismatchText1
data.value: Okta Verify blocked the verification attempt because the page might be trying to steal your information.

data.name: OriginMismatchText2
data.value: For your security, let your administrator know about the page and do not try to sign in to the suspicious page.

data.name: UserVerificationAddedWindowsHello
data.value: Windows Hello has been successfully enabled for {0}.

data.name: UserVerificationDisableConfirmationWindowsHello
data.value: Disable Windows Hello for this account?

data.name: UserVerificationDisabledWindowsHello
data.value: Windows Hello has been disabled for {0}

data.name: WindowsHelloExtraVerificationAddedSecurityWindowsHello
data.value: This allows you to use Okta Verify with Windows Hello to access apps.

data.name: URIVerificationConsentText
data.value: Are you trying to sign in?

data.name: ErrorMessageWrongUser
data.value: The user signing in did not match the user on the account.

data.name: EnrollVerifiedReturnToApp
data.comment: Message the user sees after they enrolled. Placeholder is for name of the application that started the flow.

data.name: WindowsHelloAfterSetUpText
data.value: Once set up, Okta Verify will use Windows Hello to verify your identity.

data.name: ErrorMessageOrgNotOnIdx
data.value: Your organization doesn't support Okta Verify for Windows. Contact your IT administrator.

data.name: BrowserRedirectSignInPageOpenedText
data.value: To continue, we’ll need to verify your identity

data.name: OnboardingSignIntoAppsText
data.value: Securely sign in to your organization’s apps

data.name: OnboardingToSecurelySignIntoAppsText
data.value: to securely sign in to your organization’s apps.

data.name: ReportSettingsShareDiagnosticsText
data.value: Share information regarding crashes and diagnostics with Okta

data.name: ErrorMessageDeviceDeactivated
data.value: Your admin has blocked this device. If this is unexpected, contact your admin for help.

data.name: ErrorMessageUvRequired
data.value: Your organization requires Windows Hello to add an account. Try adding your account again and enabling Windows Hello when prompted.

data.name: ExtraVerificationOrgRequiresWindowsHello
data.value: Your organization requires Windows Hello to be used with Okta Verify.

data.name: ErrorMessageCannotEnrollInRemoteSession
data.value: Your organization requires {{WindowsHello}}, which cannot be used on a Remote Desktop Session.
data.comment: {{WindowsHello}} placeholder refers to the value set in the 'WindowsHello' key

data.name: EnrollmentDeviceNotMeetingRequirementsText
data.value: This device does not meet your organization’s security requirements because it does not support biometrics, such as fingerprint or face verification. Contact your administrator for help.

data.name: AccountNotFoundAboutMessage
data.value: You’re about to set up an account for {0} to securely sign in to your organization’s apps.
data.comment: Message user sees when setting up an account. Placeholder is for organization domain.

data.name: OnboardingHowItWorksMessage
data.value: When you click the {0} button on your browser, you will be prompted to confirm your identity on this device.
data.comment: Message describing how to use the "OnboardingHowItWorksSIWButtonText" button, which is the placeholder.

data.name: OnboardingHowItWorksSIWButtonText
data.comment: Placeholder text for OnboardingHowItWorksMessage

data.name: WindowsHelloCantDisableWhileRemoteText
data.value: Windows Hello cannot be disabled in a remote session.

data.name: WindowsHelloCantEnableWhileRemoteText
data.value: Windows Hello cannot be enabled in a remote session.

data.name: ExtraVerificationWindowsHelloRequiredClickEnable
data.value: Your organization requires Windows Hello. Click Enable Windows Hello to keep using this account.
data.comment: Error message shown to user when UV is required by the server but not setup.

data.name: ExtraVerificationOrgRequiresWindowsHelloRemainsEnabled
data.value: Your organization requires Windows Hello to remain enabled

data.name: AccountDetailsWinHelloChangedClickEnable
data.value: Your device’s Windows Hello settings were changed. Click Enable Windows Hello to continue using it to verify your identity.
data.comment: Error message shown to user when UV key was lost.

data.name: ExtraVerificationOrgRequiresPasscode
data.value: Your organization requires passcode verification to be used with Okta Verify.

data.name: ExtraVerificationOrgRequiresPasscodeRemainsEnabled
data.value: Your organization requires passcode verification to remain enabled

data.name: ExtraVerificationPasscodeRequiredClickEnable
data.value: Your organization requires a passcode. Click Enable passcode verification to keep using this account.

data.name: UserVerificationAddedPasscode
data.value: Passcode verification has been successfully enabled for {0}.

data.name: UserVerificationDisableConfirmationPasscode
data.value: Disable passcode verification for this account?

data.name: UserVerificationDisabledPasscode
data.value: Passcode verification has been disabled for {0}

data.name: WindowsHelloExtraVerificationAddedSecurityPasscode
data.value: This allows you to use Okta Verify with a passcode to access apps.

data.name: WindowsHelloOrgRequiresPasscode
data.value: Your organization requires passcode verification to be used with Okta Verify.

data.name: URIVerificationReenableWindowsHelloText
data.value: To re-enable Windows Hello, tap on your account > click on Enable Windows Hello.

data.name: URIVerificationUpdateWindowsHelloTitle
data.value: Update your Windows Hello settings in Okta Verify

data.name: URIVerificationWindowsHelloChangesDetectedText
data.value: Okta Verify detected changes to your device’s Windows Hello settings. You will need to re-enable Windows Hello for your accounts.

data.name: BetaProgramCheckBoxText
data.value: Join our beta program and get early access to the latest versions of Okta Verify
data.comment: Checkbox text to ask users to join beta program to get early access to the software.

data.name: AccountInvalidatedReenrollMessage
data.value: Your device or account was invalidated for use on {{OktaVerify}}. To continue using {{OktaVerify}} on this device, re-enroll this account.
data.comment: {{OktaVerify}} refers to the value set in the 'OktaVerify' resource key

data.name: EnrollSetAsDefaultAccountTitle
data.comment: {{OktaFastPass}} refers to the value set in the 'OktaFastPass' resource key

data.name: EnrollSetAsDefaultAccountMessage
data.value: You can change your default account anytime in your account details.

data.name: AccountDetailsIsSetAsDefaultLabel
data.comment: {{OktaFastPass}} refers to the value set in the 'OktaFastPass' resource key

data.name: AccountDetailsSetAsDefaultLabel
data.comment: {{OktaFastPass}} refers to the value set in the 'OktaFastPass' resource key

data.name: AccountDetailsIsSetAsDefaultDescription
data.value: When you access {0} resources using {{OktaFastPass}}, this account is used to to sign you in
data.comment: {0} placeholder refers to the account's domain {{OktaFastPass}} placeholder refers to the value set in the 'OktaFastPass' key

data.name: AccountDetailsSetAsDefaultDescription
data.value: When you access {0} resources using {{OktaFastPass}}, your default account is used to sign you in. This account is currently not set as your default.
data.comment: {0} placeholder refers to the account's domain {{OktaFastPass}} placeholder refers to the value set in the 'OktaFastPass' key

data.name: AccountDetailsSetAsDefaultSucceededText
data.value: This account is now your default {{OktaFastPass}} account for {0}
data.comment: {0} placeholder refers to the account's domain {{OktaFastPass}} placeholder refers to the value set in the 'OktaFastPass' key

data.name: AccountInvalidatedContactAdminMessage
data.value: Your device or account was invalidated for use on {{OktaVerify}}. If this is unexpected, contact your administrator for help.
data.comment: {{OktaVerify}} refers to the value set in the 'OktaVerify' resource key

data.name: AccountMFAResetReenrollMessage
data.value: Your multi-factor authentication was reset for this device. To continue using {{OktaVerify}} on this device, re-enroll this account.

data.name: DeviceHealthProblemCheckingUpdates
data.value: There was a problem checking for Windows updates. Check your network connection, then open this page again.

data.name: DeviceHealthDiskEncryptionProvidesProtection
data.value: Disk encryption provides extra protection against hackers and malware.

data.name: DeviceHealthKeepYourDeviceSafe
data.value: Windows updates keep your device safe from potential vulnerabilities.

data.name: DeviceHealthPasswordHelpsProtectData
data.value: A password helps protect your data if your device is lost or stolen.

data.name: DeviceHealthWinHelloHelpsProtectData
data.value: {{WindowsHello}} helps protect your data by verifying your identity.

data.name: DeviceHealthProblemCheckingEncryption
data.value: There was a problem checking for disk encryption.

data.name: DeviceHealthUpToDate
data.value: Your device is up to date

data.name: DummyResource
data.comment: Added this so that loc build can be pushed.

data.name: ErrorMessageUrlNotTrusted
data.value: The sign-in URL is not secure.

data.name: ErrorMessageClientTimeSkewLine1
data.value: Device date or time might be incorrect. Go to your device's date and time settings, turn on automatic time, then try again.

data.name: ErrorMessageClientTimeSkewLine2
data.value: If automatic time is already on, try restarting your device.

data.name: CannotDeleteLastFactorMessage
data.value: To delete this method, add another method first. You need at least 1 method to sign in to Windows.

data.name: DeleteFactorMessage
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this method?

data.name: DownloadOktaVerify
data.value: On your mobile device, download and open Okta Verify.

data.name: EnterCode
data.value: Enter the code you see in Okta Verify

data.name: ErrorEnrollingFactor
data.value: There was an error enrolling this method, please try again.

data.name: FactorAddedMessage
data.value: You can sign in to Windows with

data.name: FactorDeletedMessage
data.value: will no longer sign in to Windows.

data.name: FactorListHintText
data.value: Add a method to securely sign in to Windows when you're offline.

data.name: OktaJoinUnavailableMessage
data.value: The Okta Identity Service isn’t responding. Please restart your computer or ask your administrator for help.

data.name: ScanQRCode
data.value: Open your mobile Okta Verify app, then scan the QR code to add an account.

data.name: SignInAttemptsRemainingMessage
data.value: Add a sign-in method before you’ve used all your remaining attempts. Or, you won’t be able to sign in to Windows when you're offline.

data.name: UnableToDeleteFactor
data.value: Unable to delete method, it may have already been deleted

data.name: YubiKeyCantHavePasswordMessage
data.value: Device Access doesn’t support a YubiKey with a password. Remove the password in the Yubico Authenticator app or use another YubiKey.

data.name: YubiKeyMoreThanOne
data.value: Add only 1 YubiKey at a time.

data.name: AddAccountFromAnotherDeviceMsg
data.value: If you have an Okta Verify account on another device, you can add it to this device.

data.name: EnterCodeMsg
data.value: Your other device should show a {0}-digit code. Enter the code here to connect your devices.

data.name: EnterCodeOnOtherDeviceMsg
data.value: On your other device, enter the code shown here

data.name: EnterPINFromOtherDeviceMsg
data.value: Your other device should show a {0}-digit PIN. Enter the code here to verify you’ve connected to the right device.

data.name: ErrorBluetoothAndBiometricsNotAvailable
data.value: This device does not have Bluetooth and Windows Hello which are required for this feature.

data.name: ErrorBluetoothNotAvailable
data.value: This device does not have Bluetooth, which is required for this feature.

data.name: ErrorBluetoothSessionExpired
data.value: For your security, the Bluetooth session has ended.

data.name: ErrorConnectionIssue
data.value: There was an issue with the connection.

data.name: ErrorToManyPINAttempts
data.value: To protect your account, the PIN has limited attempts per session.

data.name: ErrorWindowsHelloNotAvailable
data.value: This device does not have Windows Hello, which is required for this feature.

data.name: OnOtherDeviceOpenOV
data.value: On your other device, make sure Okta Verify is on the latest version, then open the app.

data.name: OVTurnOnBluetooth
data.value: Okta Verify will now turn on Bluetooth.

data.name: PINVerifiedMsg
data.value: PIN verified. You can safely leave this screen.

data.name: RestartSessionAndFeature
data.value: To try again with a new session, restart the “{0}” feature.

data.name: ScanOrEnterCodeStep1
data.value: 1. On your other device, download and open the Okta Verify app.

data.name: ScanOrEnterCodeStep3
data.value: 3. Follow the Bluetooth instructions, then scan this QR code or enter the code manually

data.name: ScreenAutoUpdateMsg
data.value: This screen will automatically update after you proceed on your other device.

data.name: StartOverAndTryAgain
data.value: Please start over and try again.

data.name: WhereDoIGetMyCode
data.value: Where do I get my code?

data.name: ToUseFeatureEnableUV
data.value: To use this feature, enable Windows Hello for your account.

data.name: ChooseAccountWantToAdd
data.value: Choose the account you want to add, then choose {0}.

data.name: FollowInstructionsUntilCode
data.value: Follow the instructions until a QR code is shown.

data.name: EnrollmentBootstrappingDoNotSeeFeature
data.value: If you don't see this option, it may be due to your organization's settings.
